subject: PetroChina (857 HK) to temporarily halt buying US LNG, according to Twitter sources citing reports last week
Ausdrill (ASL AT) African Underground Mining Services unit receives contract valued at AUD 160mln
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Earnings from Aurizona and GPT Group; WTI crude futures rose 1.5% and are eye USD 68/bbl to the upside
content:
AUSTRALIA

APA Group (APA AT)
- Co. enters implementation agreement with CKI consortium after the board recommended Cheung Kong Infrastructure’s bid for the Co. (Newswires)

Aurizon (AZJ AT)
- Co. FY18 underlying net from cont. ops AUD 542.1mln vs. Prev. AUD 494.7mln. (Newswires)

Bendigo & Adelaide Bank (BEN AT)
- Co. FY18 cash earnings AUD 445.1mln vs. Prev. AUD 418.3mln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Bluescope Steel (BSL AT)
- Co. FY18 underlying profit AUD 826mln vs. Exp. AUD 802mln, rev. AUD 11.5bln vs. Prev. AUD 10.5bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

GPT Group (GPT AT)
- Co. H1 net fell 3% Y/Y to AUD 728.5mln. (Newswires)

JB Hi-Fi (JBH AT)
- Co. FY18 net rose 35% Y/Y to AUD 233.2mln, rev. rose 22% Y/Y to AUD 6.85bln. (Newswires)

South32 (S32 AT)
- Co. has completed acquisition of Arizona Mining. (Newswires)

Wesfarmers (WES AT)
- Co. is to sell Kmart Tyre and Auto Service businesses to Continental for AUD 350mln and estimates a pre-tax profit from the sale at AUD 270mln-275mln. (Newswires)

Basic materials / Energy
- Reports note increasing speculation regarding IPOs in commodity related sectors including units from the likes of BHP and Rio Tinto. (The Australian)
- WTI crude futures gained 1.5% on Friday.

 

JAPAN

Don Quijote (7532 JT)
- Co. FY18 net JPY 36.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 33.1bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Japan Post Bank (7182 JT)
- Co. Q1 net JPY 78.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 89.4bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Japan Post Holdings (6178 JT)
- Co. Q1 net JPY 123.5bln vs. Prev. JPY 104.5bln Y/Y, ordinary profit JPY 210.2bln vs. Prev. JPY 218.2bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 3.16tln vs. Prev. JPY 3.27tln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Japan Post Insurance (7181 JT)
- Co. Q1 net JPY 34.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 24.2bln Y/Y, ordinary profit JPY 75.3bln vs. Prev. JPY 83.2bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Otsuka Kagu (8186 JT)
- Co. is said to be in merger discussions with Taiwan investors. (Nikkei)

Sompo Holdings (8630 JT)
- Co. Q1 net rose 105% Y/Y to JPY 55.5bln. (Newswires)

Other News
- Japanese Economy Minister Motegi stated they have agreed with US to expand trade and that they have discussed individual areas but nothing has been decided, while he added that they will conduct next meeting on trade around September. (Newswires)
- Japanese former defense minister Ishiba announced to run for LDP party head against PM Abe in the September party leadership election, although is seen to be facing a very steep uphill battle. (Nikkei)
 

SOUTH KOREA

Lotte Shopping (023530 KS)
- Co. Q2 net loss KRW 242bln vs. Exp. profit KRW 47bln. (Newswires)

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS)
- Co. is said to have earmarked KRW 20tln-30tln for overseas M&A. (Newswires)

Other news
- North Korea reportedly rejected several denuclearization proposals made by the US. (CNN)

subject: Russian Oligarch Deripaska is said to offer sanctions relief plan to US related to Rusal (486 HK) which included offer to reduce stake in EN+ to below 45%
UK employers expect to offer median pay increases of 2.0% over next 12 months which was inline Q/Q
UK Visa Consumer Spending fell 0.9% Y/Y in July vs. increase of 0.7% in June
SoftBank (9984 JT) is reported to be uninterested in Tesla (TSLA) deal as it focuses on other car investments
New Zealand Performance of Services Index (Jul) 55.1 (Prev. 52.8)
Chinese New Yuan Loans (CNY)(Jul)	1450B vs. Exp. 1275B (Prev. 1840B)
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights Include New Zealand Performance of Services and Food Prices, Singapore GDP
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA

PBoC stated on Friday that the Yuan FX forwards levy is going to include options and swaps but some FX hedging by foreign investors are not included. (Newswires)

UK/EU

Fitch upgraded Greece by 2 notches to BB- from B; Outlook Stable and reaffirmed Lithuania at A-; Outlook revised to positive. (Newswires)

UK GDP (Q2 P) Q/Q 0.4% vs. Exp. 0.4% (Prev. 0.2%). (Newswires)
UK GDP (Q2 P) Y/Y 1.3% vs. Exp. 1.3% (Prev. 1.2%)
UK Industrial Output (Jun) M/M 0.4% vs. Exp. 0.4% (Prev. -0.4%, Rev. -0.2%)
UK Industrial Output (Jun) Y/Y 1.1% vs. Exp. 0.7% (Prev. 0.8%, Rev. 1.2%)


FX

Turkish President Erdogan stated the economy is not in a crisis and that weakness in TRY is a currency plot, while he added that Turkey will win this economic war and are undergoing preparations to use national currencies for trade with nations such as China and Russia. There were also comments from Turkish Finance Minister Albayrak that the government has an action plan regarding the currency and will take necessary measures on Monday to ease market concerns, while he stated they will not convert nor seize FX deposits and that the currency is being directly targeted by the US President. In related news, Turkish Presidency Communication Chief Altun stated Erdogan’s comments were a warning against FX flight, while the banking regulator also announced to limit swap transactions in which banks’ total swap transactions has been capped at 50% of banks’ equity. (Newswires)
 

COMMODITIES

US Baker Hughes Total Rig Count (10 Aug) 1057 (Prev. 1044). (Newswires)
 

GEOPOLITICAL

US President Trump tweeted on Friday that he has authorised a double up on tariffs on steel and aluminium with respect to Turkey as their currency falls in which aluminium will now be 20% and steel at 50%. This eventually prompted a response from the Turkish Foreign Ministry which stated that Turkey will retaliate as necessary to the latest US tariffs, although there were later comments from US President Trump Lawyer Sekulow that they are close to reaching an agreement on Pastor Brunson. ( Newswires)

North Korea reportedly rejected several denuclearization proposals made by the US. (CNN)

Officials on Friday stated that Iran conducted a test launch of a ballistic missile which was its first for the year. (Fox)
 

US

US President Trump stated that a deal with Mexico is coming along nicely and that Canada must wait. In related news, there were comments on Friday from Mexico’s Economy Minister that NAFTA talks have progressed well that week and will do the upcoming week also. (Twitter/Newswires)

Saudi sovereign wealth fund reportedly has no interest in financing a privatization deal for Tesla (TSLA). (Newswires)

US CPI (Jul) Y/Y 2.9% vs. Exp. 3.0% (Prev. 2.9%). (Newswires)


MARKET RECAP

US futures followed on from the selloff in European equities amid the ongoing concerns in Turkey, which saw the Nasdaq snap its 8th daily consecutive gain. However the morning sell off in the US futures complex calmed down but stocks were further pressured as Turkey announced they will retaliate as necessary to the ‘doubling’ tariffs,  extending losses to just shy of 1% before the near agreement on Pastor Brunson was announced which saw a small reversal. Microchip (MCHP) beat on EPS and revenues fell in line with expectations, however the co. provided forecasts for its next quarter revenue which was lower than the street’s estimates. Also, the CEO of the co. said the excessive Microsemi (MSCC) inventory is a headwind for revenue in the next couple of quarters. Dropbox (DBX) were also lower after their earnings report despite beats and raising guidance, which initially saw the stock higher pre-market but as they announced they are to bring forward the lock up change to August 23rd from September 18th, gains were lost and extended to losses of ~8%. SPX -0.71% at 2833, NDX -0.79% at 7408, DJI -0.77% at 25313.

Treasuries rallied throughout the day, with yields falling to a 3week low at one point, as risk-aversion spurred by the currency crisis in Turkey shifted investors’ position away from risky assets into a bid for safe-havens. Amid decent volume, the short end of the curve was hit more than the long end; 5yr yields were lower by c.7bps and 30yr yields were lower by c.6bps.The 10yr yield posted the biggest one-day fall since late May, hitting a low of 2.85%. 2s5s narrowed by c2.5bps, 2s10 by c.2bps, whilst 5s30 widened by c.1.5bps. US 10YR T-notes settled 21 ticks higher at 120-12.

subject: Turkish bank regulator reportedly limits swap transactions
reaction_details: - This has provided some support for TRY with USD/TRY falling back below the 6.9000 handle from the 7.0000 handle prior to the news, although the pair is still higher by 7% on the session.
analysis_details: - As a guide, Turkish Finance Minister Albayrak earlier stated that the government has an action plan regarding the currency and will take necessary measures on Monday to ease market concerns.

subject: TRY continues to plunge in early Asia trade with USD/TRY higher by 10% following comments over the weekend from Turkish President Erdogan which spurred capital control fears and who labelled the weakness in TRY as a currency plot
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
